channel.title: Profile Model on OSCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Profile Model on OSCAL

item.title: Profile Model JSON Format Outline
item.description: profile [1]: {… }uuid [1]: uuid, metadata [1]: {… }, title [1]: markup-line, published [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, last-modified [1]: dateTime-with-timezone, version [1]: string, oscal-version [1]: string, revisions [0 or 1]: [ … ], An array of oscal-metadata-revision objects [1 to ∞]{ title [0 or 1]: markup-line, published [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, last-modified [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, version [0 or 1]: string, oscal-version [0 or 1]: string, props [0 or 1]: [ … ], An array of property objects [1 to ∞]{

item.title: Profile Model JSON Format Reference
item.description: OSCAL model OSCAL Profile Model Version 1.0.0-rc1 JSON Schema oscal_profile_schema.json XML to JSON converter oscal_profile_xml-to-json-converter.xsl (How do I use the converter to convert OSCAL XML to JSON?) A profile designates a selection and configuration of controls from one or more catalogs, along with a series of operations over them. The topmost element in the OSCAL profile XML schema is profile. Switch to XML add formal name Addition Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution

item.title: OSCAL Profile Model XML Format Outline
item.description: <profile uuid="uuid">… </profile>[1]<metadata>… </metadata>[1]<title>markup-line</title>[1] <published>datetime-with-timezone</published>[0 or 1] <last-modified>datetime-with-timezone</last-modified>[1] <version>string</version>[1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version>[1] <revisions>… </revisions>[0 or 1]<revision>… </revision>[0 to ∞]<title>markup-line</title>[0 or 1] <published>datetime-with-timezone</published>[0 or 1] <last-modified>datetime-with-timezone</last-modified>[0 or 1] <version>string</version>[0 or 1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version>[0 or 1] <prop name="ncname" uuid="uuid" ns="uri" value="string" class="ncname">… </prop>[0 to ∞]<remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1] </prop> <link href="uri-reference" rel="ncname" media-type="string">… </link>[0 to ∞]<text>markup-line</text>[0 or 1] </link> <remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1] </revision> </revisions> <document-id scheme="uri">string</document-id>[0 to ∞] <prop name="ncname" uuid="uuid" ns="uri" value="string" class="ncname">… </prop>[0 to ∞]<remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1]

item.title: OSCAL Profile Model XML Format Reference
item.description: OSCAL model OSCAL Profile Model Version 1.0.0-rc1 XML namespace http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal/1.0 XML Schema oscal_profile_schema.xsd JSON to XML converter oscal_profile_json-to-xml-converter.xsl (How do I use the converter to convert OSCAL JSON to XML?) A profile designates a selection and configuration of controls from one or more catalogs, along with a series of operations over them. The topmost element in the OSCAL profile XML schema is profile. Switch to JSON add formal name Addition Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution
